column4: I have tried to connect to another machine through ssh, but without any success. Do i have to change anything in /etc/ssh/ssh_config and in /etc/ssh/sshd_config. All the lines are commented.
what's the response when you try?
It hangs
and don't ask the password
/etc/ssh/sshd_config - do i have to config this files in the other machine?
the remote machine could be slow or packets might be being dropped. if you nc it on pt 22 do you see the ssh server string?
how do i see that?
sshd doesn't run by default.  This machine is within reach?
/etc/ssh/sshd_config - do i have to config this files in the other machine?
all the lines of this file are commented
and this one /etc/ssh/ssh_config
you might want to change the sshd settings if you want it to run on a diff port, but the default should be ok, is the ssh server actually running on that machine though?
i'd like to have a look in the /etc/ssh/ssh_config and /etc/ssh/sshd_config of anyone that ssh is working
Yah. But all the lines are commented
Someone told me that in debian all the lines are uncommented.
Someone told me that in debian all the lines are uncommented. And it works
you haven't answered the question yet! is the sshd running on the machine you're trying to access?
I even do not know if it is running in my machine
How do i know that
The other machine is outside my intranet
I have to access it through: ssh username@ipnumber
you don't need the server to be running on your machine to access another with ssh, only if you want someone else to connect to you
right!
